result.name: scotlands-wildness-lack-of-artefacts
result.notes:
One of four component layer of the Scottish wildness map. This layer shows the absence of the visibility of modern artefacts (or detractors). The dataset is on a scale of 1-256 indicating relative levels of visual influence. Consequently the data is best viewed at a national or regional scale. The methodology is adapted from the 2008 Wildness Study in the Cairngorms National Park.    NextMap Digital Surface Model (DSM) gives the height of the surface including the detractors from which a viewshed can be produced.  Viewsheds up to 15 km were created for 3 feature layers 1) Buildings and other structures, 2) Railway lines, roads and tracks and 3) Pylons
A fourth viewshed up to 30 km was created for wind turbines.  The resulting calculations were then re-scaled 1-256 to produce the map of lack of human artefacts

organization.description: SpatialData.gov.scot is Scotland’s catalogue of geospatial data. Here you can find, share and reuse spatial data provided by Scottish public sector organisations.
